fields.description:
This is raised from a [customer comment on CAC|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Feedback+on+Confluence+Storage+Format?focusedCommentId=284365031#comment-284365031].

I believe the analysis is spot on but to summarise, we should strive to to keep storage format at close to XHTML as possible. Additional things we need should be in our namespace. The 'data*' attribute is not valid XHTML.

Likewise, these layouts render with the data attribute as well. I imagine this is done so we can recognise layouts when we copy and paste into the Editor. Confluence now renders output to HTML 5 so this is fine.

So regarding storage format. Could we put a custom namespaced attribute on the root div of the layout? Or better still could we create a custom element to represent the layout? Perhaps something like <ac:layout>. Obviously this should transform to a <div> when we render to view.

Anyway, the point here isn't to propose a solution, but instead just to call out that the implementation detail here is deviating from one of the goals of Confluence storage format.
fields.summary: Page Layouts information is wrongly stored against a div element with a data-* attribute. This is invalid XHTML.

fields.description:
# Move a parent page with child pages to a new space in a single action. 
#* If you follow a full URL link to the *parent* page in the OLD space, you get the notification 'this page may have moved, here's a link'
#* If you follow a full URL link (to the old space) for any of the *children*, Confluence returns a 404 - page not found. 
# All the pages (parent and child pages) appear as expected in the NEW space if you search for them by name. It only occurs when following an explicit link of the form http://ourwiki/display/oldspace/child+page+name 

The impact of this is that where users have emailed or bookmarked direct URLs to the child pages, the pages appear to have vanished. There's no "this might have been deleted" or "this might have moved", just a bad URL notification. 

Workaround: Move each page individually (which can be a tediously slow operation between spaces)

fields.description:
If you insert a relative link, then it should remain relative. This means that, if you copy the source of the page from one space to another, then the relative links should point to pages in the new space, not to pages in the original space.

I have just tested the scenario described by a customer in a support case:
* In the DOC space on CAC, I created a page called "Sarah test 1". I added three links that should be relative. All of them point to a page called "Supported Platforms".  To create the links, I added one via the links autocomplete, one via the Search tab in the links browser, and one via the Advanced tab in the links browser.
* Both the DOC space and the JIRA space already have a page with the same name, "Supported Platforms".
* In the JIRA space on CAC, I created another page called "Sarah test 1", and copied the content from the above page. To copy it, I opened the above page in the editor, selected all the content, pressed Ctrl+C, then pasted the content into my new page.
* *Problem:* The links are not relative in the new page. They still point to the DOC space, whereas they should point to the identically-named page in the JIRA space.

See screenshots attached.
fields.summary: Confluence should respect relative links when copying and pasting the content of a page

fields.description:
In confluence 4.1 and previous the Space object passed with the SpaceRemoveEvent contains a valid SpaceDescription object, however in confluence 4.2.x it is null.

This prevents our code from cleaning up content properties attached to the space description.

This is a problem because when a space with the same name is re-created the content properties associated with the space description re-appear - which is not the expected behaviour for our users.

Ideally we would like the SpaceRemoveEvent to behave in the same way as it always has done, alternatively if you can suggest a way of getting to the SpaceDescription then that could present a workaround for us.
fields.summary: SpaceDescription is null inside SpaceRemoveEvent

fields.description:
We have been translating Confluence 4.2 into Turkish. One of the problems we have encountered is in likes plugin. Some sentences are formed programatically  using i18n words. The keys are

* likes.summary.word.and
* likes.summary.word.like
* likes.summary.word.likes
* likes.summary.word.others
* likes.summary.word.people
* likes.summary.word.the
* likes.summary.word.this
* likes.summary.word.you
* likes.summary.word.your

The sentence structure in Turkish is different than English. So when we translate the words the formed sentence becomes wrong. For example, in English you say "You like this", in Turkish we say, "You this like".

Forming sentences using words is not a good idea for multi-language application. It's better to have full sentences.
fields.summary: Fix Turkish translation for the comment summary in "Confluence Like Plugin"

Confluence gets lost when renaming application links.

h3.Steps to reproduce:
    Confluence 4.2.1 (Win 64-bit)

# Install JIRA
## Use Eval DB
## Port 8080
## Admin: jiraadmin
# Install Confluence
## Use Eval DB
## Port 9090

# In JIRA Administration, create App Link to Confluence

# Create test issue in JIRA, copy the URL to the clipboard
# Go to Confluence dashboard
# Create new page

New Feature: Improved Navigation to and Addition of Macros

Sometimes, I edit using macros on many pages or in many places on a single page; changing format, or applying a new style convention most often...for example, write a page with code examples, then go back and add Code Block macros to the code examples.

I would like to be able to bookmark a macro; ie, add a button to the toolbar that triggers an assigned macro. I would like for this button to trigger a macro that has already been configured. For example, a Code macro that is configured for "none" highlighting and "default" theme. Then I could select my code, click the button, click Insert, wash/rinse/repeat. Presently, the workflow is much more time consuming and repetitive.

The macro selection is difficult to navigate. I use Search every time I need a macro, but the search return state is not saved. When I need the same macro a moment later, the workflow is much more time consuming and repetitive.

fields.description:
Create an empty page. Make sure you receive notifications for your own changes. Edit the page by entering the following:

{code}
* Bullet 1
  1. Enum 1.1
  2. Enum 1.2
  Bullet 2
  1. Enum 2.1
  2. Enum 2.2
{code}

That is
* type "* " to create an itemized list, then "Bullet 1", hit enter
* hit tab, then click the enumeration button. Type "Enum 1.1", hit enter,
* type "Enum 1.2", enter,
* shift-tab, backspace once (to remove the bullet, but keep the indentation), type "Bullet 2", enter
* tab, click the enumeration button. Type "Enum 2.1", hit enter
* Type Enum 2.2, hit enter
* Save

The page will be rendered with the two enumerations as shown above; the 2nd enumeration restarting with "1". However, the email notification will look like so:

{code}
* Bullet 1
  1. Enum 1.1
  2. Enum 1.2
  Bullet 2
  3. Enum 2.1
  4. Enum 2.2
{code}

I would have expected the email notification to correspond to the page display, and restart the enumeration below "Bullet 2" with "1".

This behavior does not occur when you do not remove the bullet point before "Bullet 2".
fields.summary: Email notifications render enumerations incorrectly in special cases

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-25289].
  {panel}

When a user clicks on a full-sized image, a lightbox is displayed containing the same full sized image. This functionality makes sense for thumbnail images, however full sized-images should not have this enabled as it provides no useful benefit.

----

h5. The case for:
If users expect a larger image after clicking on the image, they might be less inclined to utilise this feature if they continually receive the same, full-sized image in the lightbox.

h5. The case against
This is pretty standard web functionality and it could confuse people if some images didn't show in a lightbox after a click. We might end up with a situation where people wonder if the functionality is working correctly and this might generate more support calls to internal IT and Atlassian.

h5. The workaround
Putting the image within a link to an anchor or ID on the page. This will disable the lightbox, albeit in a roundabout sort of way.
fields.summary: Disable lightbox for full-sized images

fields.description:
In 4.2, there is an "Add Users" link that does not seem to serve any purpose except to cause confusion to anyone with the rights to see it.

At this point, I have:
* Crowd as the only enabled user directory
* External user management enabled in Security Configuration
* Every permission disabled in Crowd that allows Confluence to change anything in Crowd. 

So, there is absolutely no way that Confluence should be advertising that new users can be added, especially with a link on the Dashboard to "Add Users". There should be a way to disable that link from being displayed if there are no directories that Confluence has rights to add users to.
fields.summary: Provide option to disable "Add User" link / signup URL from being visible to anyone
